industry: Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage
description:
OIA Global Since its founding in 1988, OIA Global has grown into a $1 billion world-class logistics and packaging company that employs over 1,200 professionals in 28 countries. Our knowledge, solution design experience, and installed infrastructure give our customers the confidence and capability to extend their supply chains from emerging production areas to key commercial markets.

The hiring rate for this position is $34.73 per hour.

Summary:
As Air Import Coordinator, you will review and process import transactions, including all related activities, for one or more major accounts, and provide excellent, proactive and timely customer service. Duties will include preparation of freight quotes, tracking of freight, and invoice processing. Your ability to anticipate customer needs and your desire to quickly resolve potential delays will create a smooth experience for all your clients.

Supervisory Responsibilities:
  • None


Duties and Responsibilities:
  • Promote a positive relationship with the client by ensuring excellent, timely and proactive customer service at all times and in conjunction with other departments and third parties
  • Track and review shipping status to ensure timely departure/arrival/delivery of freight; enter milestone data
  • Process data through the Company’s system, and obtain bank releases and other government agency releases as appropriate
  • Process arrival notices for incoming shipments
  • Work and communicate with customs brokers and logistics providers to resolve any potential issues/delays
  • Create quotations for individual shipments, including estimating prices for the shipper, and selecting transportation companies to use.


Required Skills and Abilities:
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
  • A high level of energy and a "can-do" positive attitude
  • Strong proficiency in Microsoft Office, particularly Excel, Word and Outlook
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Strong attention to detail


Education and Experience:
  • Minimum 2 years of air import experience in the freight forwarding industry.
  • Familiarity with CargoWise’s Enterprise system a plus.


Physical Requirements:
  • Prolonged periods of sitting at a desk and working on a computer
  • Must be able to lift up to 15 pounds
  • The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
